title: DJ Sona
body:
Hey!



SO, when in game, DJ Sona can allow allies to listen to her special music. Which is freakin' awesome. But her enemies can't listen to it. Which is sad.
So my idea is to let enemies listen to DJ Sona's music. Because Equality!

All in favor say Aye.
All against, gtfo :)

Cheers!

replies.body:
Enemies of DJ Sona don't deserve to listen to the music. They're clearly against equality, and goodness, and righteousness, and puppies. 

Never trust a puppy hater.

> [{quoted}](name=Sharjo,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=00mMw8IY,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-08-03T17:48:14.715+0000)
>
> Enemies of DJ Sona don't deserve to listen to the music. They're clearly against equality, and goodness, and righteousness, and puppies. 
> 
> Never trust a puppy hater.

I've agreed with you on many things, Sharjo, but never have I wanted to stand and applaud you.

People against Sona, are people against all that is good in the world.  I don't want to cultivate an us-vs-them mentality, but **it's us versus them, people!**

What I love, is that enemies of Sona may not be able to hear her music, but they'll dance to her tune.  Oh yes, they'll dance...

(Please note I don't actually know if enemies hearing DJ Sona's music is an issue or not.  Hopefully my nonsense posting here will draw the eyes of another Rioter who can actually speak with authority on the subject.  It can be hard to resist a Sona thread, though.)
shady mutes that can hypnotize you with music stands for all the good in the world just because she is pretty.... hmmm

> [{quoted}](name=LordGeovanni,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=00mMw8IY,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2016-08-03T19:11:25.610+0000)
>
> shady mutes that can hypnotize you with music stands for all the good in the world just because she is pretty.... hmmm

I'm not one to have my head turned by a pretty face - I'm more all about helping my team through the power of music, being surprisingly vicious when made AP, the mystery of her past (and the Etwahl), and the wonderfully creepy misinterpretations of the DJ Sona VO lines.  

Honestly, it sounds sometimes like she's saying "What's happening?", "Let me out.", and "They're all so amusing.".  I'm... I'm not doing well at convincing you here, am I.  Hrm.

> (Please note I don't actually know if enemies hearing DJ Sona's music is an issue or not. Hopefully my nonsense posting here will draw the eyes of another Rioter who can actually speak with authority on the subject. It can be hard to resist a Sona thread, though.)

(afaik it was never intended for DJ Sona's music to be available for the enemy team.) 

We'll make them dance. Just step in to the parlour, and listen to the sweet, sweet music...

Also, because I kinda take pride in this despite not playing as reguarly as I should:

http://imgur.com/qP63nbQ
It seems that even rioters can't get other rioters to get interested in board posts :')
They should be listening to her music when she forces them to dance with her ult.

Interesting, considering her biggest fan in the old totally no longer canon lore was Swain, who was pretty clearly against goodness and righteousness.  I don't know about puppies, but he has the look of a puppy hater.

There's actually a very tiny advantage for the enemy if they can hear the music; if they are familiar with the skin, they could hear the differences in the music and know which skill Sona leveled first.

They may also be able to take advantage of Sona players that like to switch forms shortly before engaging in a fight. This could inform the enemy that she intends to go in, even if they can't see her yet, and could therefore affect the game in a way normal Sona would not.

It's extremely minor, and the second example is entirely the Sona player's fault, but the issue is still there.

https://i.imgur.com/1HvNiEO.png?noredirect

That makes a bit of sense. But like, a teeny tiny bit. 
I'm pretty sure 99.999999% of players wouldn't use the change of music as information like "they will engage us", and even if that unique player still did, he would probably be wrong more often than not:
Whenever a Sona is in base, the only spell she will be using is the speed buff one, so when she isn't in sight, no useful information there. And when she is in sight, well, you can see what spells she uses, so the change of music won't give any extra info either.
maybe if they get the music change like 10 seconds delayed so there is no chance of them learning the audio to gague sonas cooldowns

It doesn't change with every spell-cast. Her music changes each time she casts Q/W/E for the very first time, and the first time she casts her ult after each rank.

Q/W/E add new layers to the track, and ranking her ult changes the track entirely.

But, obviously, everyone loves Sona. 
People who are forced to play against her are already depressed to have to do such a thing, to be enemies of such a goddess... why be so cruel to deprive them of her glorious tunes as well?
